intro: Deinbollia borbonica f. minor, commonly known as the dwarf waxplant, is a compact, evergreen shrub native to the island of Madagascar. It features small, glossy, ovate leaves that are typically dark green and arranged in a compact, bushy form. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom during the dry season. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and container planting. Its unique appearance and ornamental value make it a sought-after plant among horticulturists and garden enthusiasts.
